summary: CI test-npm-init job is rate limited when downloading from api.github.com. The issue persists despite a previous PR attempt to fix it. Suggested solution is to use a Cloudflare CDN in front of api.github.com for both package creation and testing.
userImpact: CI builds fail intermittently due to GitHub API rate limiting when running npm-init tests, blocking PR validation and releases.
rootCause: Missing or insufficient authentication headers in GitHub API requests during npm package initialization in CI environment, causing requests to be rate limited more aggressively.
proposedFix: Add Cloudflare CDN proxy in front of api.github.com and update both package creation and test scripts to use the CDN domain instead of direct API calls.
resolutionDetails: Fixed by ensuring auth headers are sent in all requests to GitHub API. PR #865 addresses the missing authentication header that was causing the rate limit issue.
keyQuote: Looks like we weren't sending the auth header in one of the requests, I'm fixing this.
